definition[0]: if the people in a group straggle somewhere, they go there fairly slowly and with large spaces between them
example[0]: The children were beginning to straggle in from the playground.
example[1]: Ali straggled behind, carrying the shopping.
definition[1]: to move, grow, or spread out untidily in different directions
example[3]: Unpainted wooden buildings straggle along the main road out of town.
